examples.sentence: The scarlet 'A' in The Scarlet Letter stands for 'adultery'.
Getting straight A's doesn't guarantee career success.
I saw a UFO over the Forbidden City last night.
She's dating a programmer who speaks Klingon.
Type A personalities are prone to stress-related illnesses.
This durian is grade A quality from Malaysia.
The A register stores intermediate arithmetic results.
Memory location A contains the encryption key.

examples.sentence: The AAAH just published a report on educational equity.
She received the AAAH lifetime achievement award for civil rights work.
The AAH unit demonstrated firepower during the military exercise.
This AAH model can launch shells over 30 kilometers.
The new AAH completed its maiden flight in Chengdu.
AAHs are equipped with AI-assisted targeting systems.
The sudden gust blew his toupee aback like a startled seagull.
She stepped aback in horror when seeing the durian pizza.
The celebrity was taken aback by paparazzi hiding in dumpling stalls.
Netizens were taken aback when the AI suddenly recited the Three-Character Classic.
The sails were thrown aback when the typhoon changed direction.
Ancient sailors feared having their sails taken aback more than sea monsters.
The grandma was taken aback by her grandson's neon pink haircut.
My grandfather still calculates grocery costs on his abacus faster than I can use a calculator.
The abacus in the museum had beads made of precious jade.
Some computer algorithms are inspired by the operation principles of the abacus.
The abacus function in this software simulates traditional calculation methods.
Japanese soroban abacus competitions attract thousands of participants annually.

examples.sentence: The startup abandoned its metaverse project after burning 2 billion yuan.
Never abandon your original aspiration, just like hotpot never abandens spicy broth.
The meme 'abandoned cat head' went viral on Douyin.
Abandoned shared bikes became urban scrap mountains.
He abandoned himself to livestream shopping every night.
The writer abandoned herself to the aroma of stinky tofu for inspiration.
Dancing with abandon during square dancing is true freedom.
Her singing had a wild abandon that shocked the judges.
After final exams, students abandon themselves to hotpot feasts.

examples.sentence: The abandoned factory now serves as a graffiti paradise.
Rescuers found three abandoned kittens in a McDonald's takeout bag.
The dancer moved with abandoned grace during the live stream.
Her abandoned laughter echoed through the quiet library.
The movie depicts the abandoned lifestyle of 1920s jazz musicians.
His abandoned spending habits eventually led to debt.
The police station set up a 'baby safety island' for abandoned children.
He abandoned himself to mobile games during quarantine.
The abandonment of his PhD thesis shocked his advisor.
Urban explorers love the eerie beauty of train abandonment sites.
Pet abandonment spikes before Spring Festival every year.
The rusty bicycle showed signs of long-term abandonment.
Her karaoke performance was pure abandonment of dignity.
Dancing with wild abandonment at the music festival.
Left-behind children often develop a deep sense of abandonment.

examples.sentence: The scandal abased the celebrity from A-list to D-list overnight.
In ancient times, defeated generals were abased to clean stables.
Don't abase yourself by begging for likes on social media.
The arrogant CEO abased his employees publicly.
He abased himself to get promotion opportunities.
Never abase yourself for unrequited love.
The dictator's abasement of intellectuals caused brain drain.
Corporate abasement of frontline workers often backfires.
Eating humble pie felt like public abasement.
The kneeling order was designed for ritual abasement.
Monks practice abasement by cleaning toilets barehanded.
Her abasement before the relics moved pilgrims.
His constant self-abasement masked deep insecurity.

examples.sentence: The sudden pop quiz abashed the unprepared students.
His intense stare abashed the kitten, making it hide under the sofa.
Being caught stealing mooncakes abashed the raccoon deeply.
Her outstanding Mandarin abashed me as a foreigner.
The microphone feedback abashed the rookie host.
My mom showing baby photos abashed me in front of my date.
He abashed himself after realizing his cultural misunderstanding.
The rookie stood abashed when his dumpling fell apart during the cooking show.
She felt abashed after sending a love confession to the wrong WeChat group.
The CEO was abashed when his childhood karaoke video went viral on Douyin.
I was abashed when my mom showed my preschool drawings to my date.
He stood abashed in the luxury store wearing slippers.
The government abated taxes to boost the pandemic-hit economy.
She abated her gaming time before final exams.
This new drug can abate arthritis pain effectively.
The rain abated the summer heat temporarily.
The outdated law was finally abated last year.
The court abated the unfair contract.
The typhoon abated after hitting the coastline.
His enthusiasm didn't abate even after failures.
The landlord was ordered to abate the noise nuisance.
Flights resumed after the snowstorm abated.

examples.sentence: The abatement of smog in Beijing made the Great Wall visible again.
Noise abatement measures include installing soundproof windows.
Traditional Chinese medicine focuses on pain abatement.
The court considered his donation as grounds for penalty abatement.
Early-bird registrants get a 20% tuition abatement.
Tax abatement policies attract tech startups to this area.
The abatement of construction work during exams is campus tradition.
Noise abatement orders forced the night market to close early.
Noise abatement zones surround hospitals and schools.
The tax abatement program saved my startup ï¿¥500,000 last year.

examples.sentence: The smell from the abattoir made the whole neighborhood protest.
Modern abattoirs use advanced stunning technology to minimize animal suffering.
The Colosseum was essentially an abattoir for gladiators.
In ancient times, an abattoir could refer to both animal and human slaughter sites.
The abbess brewed herbal tea with 500-year-old monastery recipes.
This abbess revolutionized convent life by introducing yoga classes.
The Abbess of Westminster was invited to bless the new parliament.
The Westminster Abbey has hosted every British coronation since 1066.
Tourists mistake the abbey's wine cellar for a bomb shelter.
The Beatles' final album cover was shot on Abbey Road.
Fans recreate the Abbey Road crossing photo every 10 minutes.

examples.sentence: The abbot led vespers with a voice as deep as monastery wine cellars.
Young monks secretly called their strict abbot 'the WiFi router' - he controlled all connections to God.
The abbot of Shaolin Temple demonstrated kung fu while reciting Buddhist scriptures.
Visitors mistook the abbot's simple robe for poverty, not knowing it cost three months' alms.
The election of abbot primate is more intense than papal conclave for Benedictines.

examples.sentence: NASA abbreviates 'National Aeronautics and Space Administration'.
Gen Z often abbreviates 'laugh out loud' to LOL.
The professor abbreviated the 3-hour lecture into 10 key points.
I abbreviated my 2000-word essay to meet the limit.
Medical professionals abbreviate frequently in prescriptions.
WeChat users abbreviate words to type faster.
We abbreviate 'application' to 'app' now.
LOL is an abbreviated form of 'laugh out loud'.
In text messages, 'u' is an abbreviated spelling of 'you'.
The director released an abbreviated version of the 3-hour movie.
This is an abbreviated spring festival gala for overseas audiences.
The teacher gave us an abbreviated explanation of quantum physics.
I only read the abbreviated news report during my subway ride.
'Tsunami' is often abbreviated to 'tsu' in Japanese maps.
The chemical element names are written in abbreviated form in the periodic table.

examples.sentence: The abbreviation 'ASAP' actually makes people work slower.
In China, 'awsl' is the most emotional abbreviation in bullet comments.
The abbreviation 'Dr.' can mean both doctor and debtor in legal documents.
Chinese netizens created the abbreviation 'yyds' to worship their idols.
The abbreviation of meeting time made everyone secretly cheer.
High-speed rail caused the abbreviation of travel time between cities.
ATM is the most confusing common abbreviation for elders.
Gen Z invented text message abbreviations like 'tbh' to save thumb energy.

examples.sentence: The CEO abdicated his controlling shares during the scandal.
Britain's King Edward VIII abdicated the throne for love in 1936.
When the Queen abdicates, the Crown Prince will succeed.
The emperor abdicated after losing the watermelon-throwing battle.
Three players abdicated from the spicy hotpot challenge.
The minister abdicated after the emoji usage scandal.
Good leaders never abdicate responsibility for team failures.
The abdication of Edward VIII caused a constitutional crisis in 1936.
Japanese emperors' abdication ceremonies involve ancient Shinto rituals.
His sudden abdication from the chess tournament shocked all players.
The athlete's abdication of her medal sparked doping suspicions.
The CEO's abdication letter cited 'pursuing TikTok fame' as reason.
After the milk tea scandal, three ministers announced their abdication.
Qianlong Emperor's abdication letter is displayed in the Palace Museum.
Blaming the pandemic for all mistakes is pure abdication of responsibility.
The Tibetan singing bowl's vibrations made his abdomen tingle like carbonated water.
Pandas often roll on their abdomens after eating bamboo, looking like furry dumplings.
